sentences.en: a rowdy crowd at the pub
sentences.cn: 酒吧里一群闹哄哄的家伙

sentences.en: A rowdy group of boys ran through the streets.
sentences.cn: 一群吵闹的男孩跑过街道.

sentences.en: A rowdy kid like that is just the kind that parents dote on.
sentences.cn: 做父母所宠爱的,正是这种调皮捣蛋的孩子.

sentences.en: At sunrise Marjorie was awakened by rowdy passengers singing on their way to bed.
sentences.cn: 天一亮,玛卓丽被一群吵吵闹闹、唱着歌、刚准备就寝的旅客吵醒.

sentences.en: He has complained to the police about rowdy neighbours.
sentences.cn: 他向警方投诉邻居们太吵闹。

sentences.en: He wanted to crack the rowdy over the head, but refrained.
sentences.cn: 他想猛击小流氓的头, 可还是忍住了.

sentences.en: I have to sit on the class when they get too rowdy.
sentences.cn: 班上学生太闹时,我就得管一管.

sentences.en: It was a very rowdy meeting.
Rowdy meetings should have no fears for an old professional like you.
sentences.cn: 会上出现的争吵捣乱当然不会使你这样的老行家感到惊惶失措.

sentences.en: Rowdy mobs gathered in the leading thoroughfares.
sentences.cn: 一群暴徒在要道聚众闹事.

sentences.en: The teacher read the riot act to the rowdy class.
sentences.cn: 老师狠狠地警告喧闹的全班同学.

sentences.en: There were rowdy scenes inside parliament during the debate.
sentences.cn: 在争论的过程中，国会内部一片混乱。

sentences.en: They were chucked out of the pub for being too rowdy.
sentences.cn: 他们因为太吵闹被撵出酒馆.

sentences.en: Usually they're not too rowdy, but tonight something was going on.
sentences.cn: 平时他们也不是很吵闹的但今晚有点奇怪.

sentences.en: We don't let Timothy play with those rowdy children.
sentences.cn: 我们不让提莫西和那些嚣张的孩子们玩.

trans.tran_en: behaving in a noisy rough way that is likely to cause arguments and fighting

trans.tran_cn: 粗暴而又好争吵的人, 吵嚷者, 小流氓
trans.tran_en: someone who behaves in a rough noisy way
